page.title: 20ST . GILES CHURCH
page.content: The parish church of St. Giles stands in the north part of the parish. The walls are made of flint,rubble and brick.It was built in the 1380's. The porch was built around 1500.In 1962 the roof was restored.The door which was moved to the outside of the porch dates from the 16th century.The nave and the chancel are from the original building.The north isle was added in the late 16th century .The font which dates from the 17th century was used for a while as a tea-caddy in Swakelys House .During the 17th century the mortuary chamber was added by the Haringtons of Swakelys. In 1914 30 coffins were removed and reburied in the graveyard. The chamber is now called the St.John's Chapel. BY ELEANOR JACKSON
